data.title: Sarakino House of Literature
data.meta_description: Sarakino is a special villa retreat in the middle of the breathtaking island of Zakynthos, close to town and with ideal access to stunning beaches, landmarks and villages.
data.text:
"Where Venus was virgin born, and made those islands bloom with her first smile;"

-Ugo Foscolo

Birthplace of Greece's national poet, Dionysios Solomos and home to the rare Caretta Caretta sea-tortoise, Zakynthos is a rhapsody of blues and greens. Boasting Greece’s legendary beach – the Shipwreck – Zakynthos is a siren that fascinates visitors with her evergreen olive groves and vineyards, golden sand beaches, temperate waters, gastronomic delights and fascinating trails.

Literature origins date back to the 15th Century at which time island poets were popular for their poems, prose, and translating texts from ancient Greek to modern Greek. A century later important literary figures such as Martelaos, Gouzelis, Matesis, Foscolo, Kalvos and of course Solomos, emerge.

How to reach Zakynthos and Sarakino
